newsitem.title: USA: U.S. switches to daylight time on Sunday.
newsitem.headline: U.S. switches to daylight time on Sunday.

text.p: Most of the United States switches to daylight saving time on Sunday for the next seven months when clocks are turned ahead one hour at 2 a.m. in each time zone.
There will be no time change in Arizona, Hawaii, the part of Indiana in the eastern time zone, Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands and American Samoa which remain on standard time all year.
Daylight time is observed from the first Sunday in April until the last Sunday in October. Standard time returns to the rest of the country this year on Oct. 26.
